page.title: 14Village Entertainment
page.content: The BMI was built in the late 19th century by the Birchhall Family.It was built for the the benifit of the Village. It is a place to meet without spending money. The membership fee is 1.00. Facilities include a pool table and a skittle alley, a snooker table and a dart board. It is also used as a head quarters for the tug of war team and football and cricket teams. The Village Hall was also built by Major Birchall and is one of the main places for social gatherings. Every week they have different clubs which include, Brownies, Cubs, WI, Scouts, Badminton and the Youth Club. You can also hire the village hall for Discos and party's '3.50 per hour. One of the most popular activity is the playgroup and forty children usually attend.
